args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Prove that if the 2x2 matrix M represents a complex number a+ib, then M has two eigenvalues: a ¬± i b with the corresponding eigenvectors [1; ‚àì i]. -/
theorem hasEigenvalues_complex_2x2 (a b : ‚ÑÇ) :
  ‚àÉ v1 v2 : Fin 2 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ, ‚àÉ Œª1 Œª2 : ‚ÑÇ,
    let M : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ‚ÑÇ := ![![a, -b], ![b, a]] in
    M.mulVec v1 = Œª1 ‚Ä¢ v1 ‚àß M.mulVec v2 = Œª2 ‚Ä¢ v2 ‚àß Œª1 = a + b * I ‚àß Œª2 = a - b * I := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-- If M is the 2x2 matrix representing a complex number a + i b, then M has eigenvalues a ¬± i b with eigenvectors [1; ‚àì i]. -/
theorem hasEigenvalues_complex_2x2 (a b : ‚ÑÇ) :
  ‚àÉ v1 v2 : Fin 2 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ, ‚àÉ Œª1 Œª2 : ‚ÑÇ,
    let M := ![![a, -b], ![b, a]] in
      M.mulVec v1 = Œª1 ‚Ä¢ v1 ‚àß M.mulVec v2 = Œª2 ‚Ä¢ v2 ‚àß Œª1 = a + b * Complex.I ‚àß Œª2 = a - b * Complex.I := by

import Mathlib

/-- If M is the 2x2 matrix representing a complex number a + i b, then M has eigenvalues a ¬± i b with eigenvectors [1; ‚àì i]. -/
theorem hasEigenvalues_complex_2x2 (a b : ‚ÑÇ) :

    let M := ![![a, -b], ![b, a]] in
      M.mulVec v1 = l1 ‚Ä¢ v1 ‚àß M.mulVec v2 = l2 ‚Ä¢ v2 ‚àß l1 = a + b * Complex.I ‚àß l2 = a - b * Complex.I := by

import Mathlib

/-- If M is the 2x2 matrix representing a complex number a + i b, then M has eigenvalues a ¬± i b with eigenvectors [1; ‚àì i]. -/
theorem hasEigenvalues_complex_2x2 (a b : ‚ÑÇ) :
  ‚àÉ v1 v2 : Fin 2 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ, ‚àÉ l1 l2 : ‚ÑÇ,
    let M := ![![a, -b], ![b, a]] in
      M.mulVec v1 = l1 ‚Ä¢ v1 ‚àß M.mulVec v2 = l2 ‚Ä¢ v2 ‚àß l1 = a + b * Complex.I ‚àß l2 = a - b * Complex.I := by
